intro: Rinorea claessensii, commonly known as the white-flowered rinorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rinorea claessensii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
